problem_text: The perpendicular bisectors of \triangle RST meet at point D. Find DT.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: ∠SAR, DT, CR ⊥ CS, ∠CTR, AS, D on CR, AT, ∠ADC, ∠SCR, DS, CS, AD, D on AS, CR, 16 = RT, AR, CR ⊥ CT, CD ⊥ CT, AR ⊥ AS, 3.14 = pi, C on ST, ∠STA, ∠TAS, CT, ∠CDS, 4.68 = CD, A on RT, DR, AD ⊥ AR, ST, CD, ∠TRD, 9 = DS, RT, AS ⊥ AT, ∠ASC, ∠AST, ∠RCT, ∠TRC

Step 2:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : CR ⊥ CS
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠SCR

Step 3:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠SCR, D on CR
Conclusions: ∠SCD = ∠SCR

Step 4:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : D on AS, D on CR
Conclusions: ∠CDS = ∠RDA

Step 5:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : CR ⊥ CT
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠RCT

Step 6:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : AR ⊥ AS
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠SAR

Step 7:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠STA, C on ST
Conclusions: ∠CTA = ∠STA

Step 8:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : D on AS, ∠TAS
Conclusions: ∠TAD = ∠TAS

Step 9:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠SAR, ∠TAS
Conclusions: pi = ∠SAR + ∠TAS

Step 10:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠ADC, ∠CDS
Conclusions: pi = ∠ADC + ∠CDS

Step 11:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : A on RT, ∠CTR
Conclusions: ∠CTA = ∠CTR

Step 12:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : DR, AR, AD
Conclusions: △ADR

Step 13:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : AD ⊥ AR
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠DAR

Step 14:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : AT, ST, AS
Conclusions: △AST

Step 15:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : CT, CD, DT
Conclusions: △CDT

Step 16:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : DS, CS, CD
Conclusions: △CDS

Step 17:
Theorem: Definition of Quadrilateral
Premises : CT, AT, CD, AD
Conclusions: Quadrilateral(A, D, C, T)

Step 18:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : A on RT, ∠TRD
Conclusions: ∠ARD = ∠TRD

Step 19:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : RT, CR, CT
Conclusions: △CRT

Step 20:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : AS ⊥ AT
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠TAS

Step 21:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : D on AS, ∠ASC
Conclusions: ∠ASC = ∠DSC

Step 22:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on ST, ∠AST
Conclusions: ∠ASC = ∠AST

Step 23:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : D on AS, ∠AST
Conclusions: ∠AST = ∠DST

Step 24:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠RCT, D on CR
Conclusions: ∠DCT = ∠RCT

Step 25:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : D on CR, ∠TRC
Conclusions: ∠TRC = ∠TRD

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠SCR, ∠SCD = ∠SCR, pi / 2 = ∠RCT
Conclusions: ∠RCT = ∠SCD

Step 27:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠ADC + ∠CDS
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠ADC + ∠CDS

Step 28:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CTA = ∠STA, ∠CTA = ∠CTR
Conclusions: ∠CTR = ∠STA

Step 29:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(R, D, A)
Premises : △ADR
Conclusions: pi = ∠ARD + ∠DAR + ∠RDA

Step 30:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(A, S, T)
Premises : △AST
Conclusions: pi = ∠AST + ∠STA + ∠TAS

Step 31:
Theorem: Pythagorean Theorem
Premises : △CDT, CD ⊥ CT
Conclusions: DT = SqrtOf(CD ** 2 + CT ** 2)

Step 32:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(C, D, S)
Premises : △CDS
Conclusions: pi = ∠CDS + ∠DSC + ∠SCD

Step 33:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Quadrilateral(A, D, C, T)
Premises : Quadrilateral(A, D, C, T)
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠ADC + ∠CTA + ∠DCT + ∠TAD

Step 34:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(T, R, C)
Premises : △CRT
Conclusions: pi = ∠CTR + ∠RCT + ∠TRC

Step 35:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠DAR, pi / 2 = ∠TAS, ∠TAD = ∠TAS
Conclusions: ∠DAR = ∠TAD

Step 36:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ASC = ∠AST, ∠AST = ∠DST
Conclusions: ∠ASC = ∠DST

Step 37:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠SAR, ∠DCT = ∠RCT, pi / 2 = ∠RCT
Conclusions: ∠DCT = ∠SAR

Step 38:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ARD = ∠TRD, ∠TRC = ∠TRD
Conclusions: ∠ARD = ∠TRC

Step 39:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠AST + ∠STA + ∠TAS
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠AST + ∠STA + ∠TAS

Step 40:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi = ∠CDS + ∠DSC + ∠SCD, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠CDS + ∠DSC + ∠SCD

Step 41:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠CTR + ∠RCT + ∠TRC
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠CTR + ∠RCT + ∠TRC

Step 42:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ASC = ∠DSC, ∠ASC = ∠DST
Conclusions: ∠DSC = ∠DST

Step 43:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DSC = ∠DST, ∠AST = ∠DST
Conclusions: ∠AST = ∠DSC

Step 44:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : ∠AST = ∠DSC, pi = ∠ARD + ∠DAR + ∠RDA, 3.14 = ∠CDS + ∠DSC + ∠SCD, 3.14 = ∠ADC + ∠CDS, ∠CDS = ∠RDA, pi = ∠SAR + ∠TAS, 3.14 = ∠AST + ∠STA + ∠TAS, ∠RCT = ∠SCD, ∠DCT = ∠SAR, ∠CTR = ∠STA, ∠DAR = ∠TAD, ∠ARD = ∠TRC, ∠CTA = ∠CTR, 2 * pi = ∠ADC + ∠CTA + ∠DCT + ∠TAD, 3.14 = ∠CTR + ∠RCT + ∠TRC
Conclusions: ∠CDS = ∠CTR

Step 45:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠RCT = ∠SCD, ∠CDS = ∠CTR
Conclusions: △CDS ~ △CTR

Step 46:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △CDS ~ △CTR
Conclusions: CD / CT = DS / RT, ∠CDS = ∠CTR

Step 47:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 16 = RT, 4.68 = CD, CD / CT = DS / RT, 9 = DS
Conclusions: 9 / 16 = 4.68 / CT

Step 48:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 9 / 16 = 4.68 / CT
Conclusions: 8.32 = CT

Step 49:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 4.68 = CD, 8.32 = CT
Conclusions: 9.55 = SqrtOf(CD ** 2 + CT ** 2)

Step 50:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 9.55 = SqrtOf(CD ** 2 + CT ** 2), DT = SqrtOf(CD ** 2 + CT ** 2)
Conclusions: 9.55 = DT
